article: Engaged in work, Rose aged 27, reached the destination hurriedly to meet visitors:her parents were coming in for Thanksgiving from her hometown.But as she hurried down the _ stairs,she started to feel _ . When she got to the platform,Rose felt weak and tired--maybe it hadn't been a good idea to give blood the night before,she thought.She rested herself _ a post close to the tracks. Several yards away,Frank,43 and his girlfriend, Jennifer found a spot close to _ the front of the train would stop. They were deep in _ about a house they were thinking of buying. But when he heard the scream, _ by someone yelling,"Oh,my God,she fell in!" Frank didn't hesitate.He _ down to the tracks and ran some 40 feet toward the body lying on the rails. "No! Not you!" his girlfriend _ after him. She was _ to be alarmed.By the time Frank reached Rose,he could feel the tracks _ and see the light coming. The train was about 20 _ from the station. It was _ to lift her.She was just out.But he managed to raise her four feet to the platform so that bystanders could hold her by the grip and _ her away from the edge.That was where Rose briefly regained _ ,felt herself being pulled along the ground, and someone else holding her _ .Rose thought she'd been robbed.A woman held her hand and a man gave his shirt to help _ the blood pouring from her head. _ she tried to talk but she couldn't, and that was when she realized how much pain she was in. Police and fire officials _ arrived,and Frank told what had happened.Jennifer said her boyfriend was calm on their 40-minute train ride downtown---just as he had been seconds after the _ which made her think about her _ at the time."I saw the train coming and 1 was thinking he was going to die,"she explained.
